answerText: Elmer J. Fudd [accept either][10] In "Water, Water Every Hare" and one other short, Bugs Bunny twice faces off against the creation of a mad scientist: an orange monster made entirely out of this substance.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 4 | 18 | Trash | None | College
subject: Trash
question: Question: Answer some questions about the antagonists of Bugs Bunny [10] This incompetent hunter's difficulties with pronouncing the letter "r" are amply demonstrated in his catchphrase: "Be vewy, vewy quiet. I'm huting wabbits."
